forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 58. West southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city stirs beneath a blanket of mostly cloudy skies. There’s a hint of drizzle, a fleeting embrace of moisture that reflects the chill of a low temperature settling around 58 degrees. The subtle murmur of the breeze, a gentle west-southwest wind, breathes life into the early hour, carrying with it traces of the expansive bay that lies just beyond. Looking out, the horizon struggles to emerge from the gray, with the iconic silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge appearing only semi-formed through the dim haze, offering a soft reminder of the landmarks held dear by locals and visitors alike.

As Saturday unfolds, the forecast hints at a break in the gloom, teasing a slight chance of drizzle in the morning before yielding to moments of sunshine. Later in the day, as the sun endeavors to stretch its arms, temperatures will tiptoe up to around 67 degrees, eventually settling near 65 in the afternoon. Given the persistent marine layer, it might be prudent to dress in layers — perhaps a light jacket for the morning’s brisk embrace, transitioning to a short-sleeved shirt as the sun's warmth breaks through. Take this opportunity to stroll along a quiet neighborhood street, sip on coffee at a local café with outdoor seating, or perhaps visit a small gallery, where the artistic spirit of the city thrives, protected from the elements and awash in soft light.
